data.title: [RA] [Balance] Allied Defensive Structures - Increase Cost & Production Time.
data.body:
- Pillbox cost $600, up from $400
- Camo Pillbox cost $800, up from $600
- Gun Turret cost $800, up from $600

The opinions on this issue is pretty much one sided among both casual and competetive players. Might as well refer to the main discussion thread on topic: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=19825 You'll be able to find the same opinions scattered throughout various balance discussions on the forum. E.g.:
http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=298839#298839
http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=19845
http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=19854

To summarize shortly, the cheap Pillboxes and Gun Turrets simply provides the incentive for Allies players to spam them non-stop throughout games, securing all flanks almost for free preventing counterattacks, expanding with little-to-no risk and quickly fortifying an lone MCV expansion literally within the minute. 

The changes has been playtested on modded maps delivered by Frame Limiter, FiveAces and myself (playtest maps v1.4) on and off stream with a few hunded downloads as well as on a playtest build showcased on stream, with particular feedback on the latter: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=298663#298663

Additionally this specific balance issue has been in context of ideas involving reducing defensive structure's production bonus of multiple MCV's and/or also reducing the custom build time for the MCV itself. These are showing some good promise but hasn't been covered in the same extent as the above. By itself this balance PR is regarded as a step in the right direction.

data.title: [RA] Rename Shipyard and Transport Helicopter
data.body:
Adresses #12197 of which don't need meddling with SHP files.

- Shipyard -> Naval Yard

Because it's a Naval Yard in the build tab and it's called Naval Yard by players. #5992

- Transport Helicopter -> Chinook

Same reasoning as above.

data.title: Let large fire turn into small fire before they extinguish.
data.body:
![treeburn](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/21082464/4c31ac74-bfdc-11e6-9df4-bfef97864ea7.jpg)

Currently they both vanish simoultaneously. It would be a nice visual polish to let the larger fire turn into smaller ones first.

data.title: [RA] Increase Nuke Damage vs Trees
data.body:
An offshoot of #12236

Nuke _does_ turn trees to 'burnt' at a certain range for various nuke weapons. #12236 came after an observation that it didn't, reason being that the range in which trees does burn out is relatively small and so the experience in-game could give the same impression simply because nuke targets are generally not in vicinity of trees/forest.

I added additional warheads to the nuke, nuketruck and cratenuke to add a few extra cells worth of damage. Respectively it adds approximately 3, 2 and 1 cells of further burnt damage. A trivial matter really but the nuke feels more physically impactful that way. 

I've isolated `Trees` to their own `Warhead@areanuke` for simplicity sake.

Range comparison, a-bomb:
![nuke1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/21082364/5df7ba68-bfda-11e6-8c3d-e18b5adfd488.jpg)

I also took into account the effect vs effect on units/structures so as to make it visually consistent, E.g. a-bomb:
![nuke2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/21082384/b978906a-bfda-11e6-8a3a-692a7c3452a4.jpg)

I couldn't leave the nukecrate alone. In the bleed it only burns down trees within 1 cell range. In this PR:
![nukecrate](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/21082417/5093ac46-bfdb-11e6-8276-2c190ec3f89a.png)

data.title: Rework shellmap UX.
data.body:
This fixes a bunch of long-ignored annoyances with our shellmaps.

#### Mute the shellmap activity for all mods.
This one is a no-brainer that has been talked about for ages.  This also disables the world sounds while the ingame menu is active, as suggested in #11355.

Closes #5619.
Closes #10700.
Closes #11355.
Closes #12299.

#### Remove the disable shellmap option.
I expect this will be a bit controversial, but the main reason for this toggle to exist was to mute the shellmap.  Removing it cleans up the hacky code that implemented it, and puts an end to the bugs that keep on sneaking in for people with it disabled.

Closes #4966.
Closes #10762.

#### Replace the TD shellmap with the "shellmap disabled" background.
I expect this will also be quite controversial, but this is another case where a long-unfinished feature has sat rotting for years with no progress.  IMO this background is more polished than the unfinished shellmap, and it serves as an example for modders who might want to do a more elaborate non-map menu background.

Closes #3016.
Closes #6943.

data.title: ReinforceWithTransport can be blocked
data.body:
in a LUA script using Reinforcements.ReinforceWithTransport() uses a transport which can be blocked from landing by vehicle-impassable terrain or units placed underneath.

It does not try to "scatter" and land in an adjacent tile like the transport of the HarvesterInsurance or the regular Carryall. Idk if this has to do with carryall.reinforce and its carryall child, but exchanging those two in the LUA function doesn't change the behaviour.

Please fix, I need this for a map.

Cheers.

data.title: Allow actors to only attack with the most effective weapon
data.body:
OpenRA's behaviour is that all weapons which are valid for a target will be used.

In the original Westwood games, however, units used only the most effective weapon.
While the current behaviour should stay the default mode, I think we should at least add the option for legacy behaviour to the Attack* traits, as this might be useful for third-party mods and maybe some units in the 'official' mods as well.

data.title: Upgrades overhaul part 4d: Other condition granters
data.body: This PR rounds out part 4 of the upgrades overhaul, which (across the 4 PRs) migrates the yaml rules over to the new conditions syntax.

data.title: Activities re-write, part 2 - Child and composite activities
data.body: I'm confident enough with the code now to inflict it on reviewers to shake out the last bugs.

data.title: Remove broken and disabled by default Server.TimeOut setting.
data.body: Closes #12294.

data.title: Reset server slots and reenable spectators when the last player quits.
data.body: Fixes #12442.

data.title: Reduce aircraft not being targetable at the north edge of the map.
data.body: This fixes two of the problems contributing to #9552, fixing the exploit where helicopters at the north edge of the map won't be `AutoTarget`ed by AA.  The problem is reduced (but remains) for fixed-wing aircraft; fixing them properly will require the flight code to predict ahead and turn *before* reaching the edge of the map.

data.title: Added Replays are showing team chats
data.body: Closes #12373.

data.title: Infantry "kickbox" animation use for combat instead of idle animation
data.body:
As the tile says, i think the primary use of that animation was for close combat,or for some sort of "movie scene" in-game,like in modern 3D games.

but it needs to be a weapon activated by distance and target. 

And it is rather boring seen all your infantry dancing around like some martial art masters,and never do any real close combat.

data.title: AI Squads and AI map locations
data.body:
AI in OpenRa is like a child that needs guidance,it needs love and.. ok to the point

AI Squads: multiple squads for multiple targets, based on IF system an example..
enemy targeted player has (6) of (tnk3), then build squad (anti_tank_squad).

the squad must be defined of course. another example 

enemy target player has (1) (nuke), then build squad (attack_hellis)
self have squad (attack_hellis) in squad pool, then attack defined target.

so basically like red alert 2 AI.

AI map locations:
ok here is the interesting part,in order for example to make the AI to transport units from island to island,you have to script it,so what if the AI will just search of existing pre defined map locations to do that. you place a point on the map called lets say "NavyPortLoad" and you link it with the player starting point,so the AI will know that it relates to it,and can use it.so the AI builds up a transport ship and sent it at that point,and then loads up the units,and then it sent them to another point called "NavyPortUnLoad" that point is linked to "NavyPortLoad" of the AI that is currently attacking,so the AI will know that it can path to that point.in some detail

Player01 starting point
        Links: NavyPortLoad1, NavyPortLoad2

NavyPortLoad1:
        Links: NavyPortUnLoad4, NavyPortUnLoad1, NavyPortUnLoad6

NavyPortUnLoad4
        LinksToPlayer: Player07, Player03

I Know all this sound like mambo jumbo,but the execution is up to the dev's,the point is the idea.
the maper just needs to add some points that act like "highways" and link them so the AI will know what it can reach and use.

data.title: Map border exploit,No anti air defense targeting.
data.body:
Anti air defense won't target air units if they are at the top border of the map.
this renders the air defenses useless at that location,and allows the "attacking" player to pass through with ease hes\hers air units.

A replay of the Border Problem.

http://www.gamereplays.org/openra/replays.php?game=92&show=details&id=315857

data.title: Fix AI superweapon usage.
data.body: For testcase, just spectate an AI match on http://resource.openra.net/maps/17498.

data.title: Upgrades overhaul part 4c: Cargo and Passenger
data.body:
Depends on #12406.

The `GrantUpgrades` field on `Passenger` has been moved to `PassengerConditions` on `Cargo`.  This avoids adding the (IMO unnecessary) complexity of external conditions to the cargo code.

Requiring the conditions to be defined for every actor type might be controversial, so an alternative could be to rework the cargo code to support multiple `CargoType`s on a `Passenger`, and then have the conditions keyed on this.

The test case extends the one from #12406 to show how passenger conditions can be stacked for improved bonuses (2x e1 = green, 3x e1 = blue).

data.title: Spies can't detect enemy disguised spies
data.body:
Nothing happens when an enemy (disguised) spy come in the radius of own spy (whether own spy is disguised or not / whether there are units alongside own spy or not)

Replay : https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B4bdF_48xIwKUFpsSlhRYkFVcnM

data.title: Making a server unusable.
data.body: If you join an empty server and check "disable spectators", then jump to the spectator slot yourself, you're able to close all of the open player slots. Once you disconnect from that server it will be inaccessible. The server player slots will show as 0/0 in the lobby and prompt as a full game if you try to join.
